document.docAuthor: Shi, Benze, Yu, Tingting & Xu, Kuidong
document.docTitle: Paramphimonhystrella longispicula Shi & Yu & Xu 2017, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Paramphimonhystrella (Nematoda, Monhysterida, Xyalidae) from the deep-sea sediments in the Western Pacific Ocean and adjacent shelf seafloor

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Paramphimonhystrella (Nematoda, Monhysterida, Xyalidae) from the deep-sea sediments in the Western Pacific Ocean and adjacent shelf seafloor

subSubSection.paragraph: ( Figures 2 , 3 ; Table 1 )

Diagnosis. Body length 842–942 µm. Buccal cavity elongated cylindro-conical, 12–16 µm deep and 5 µm wide. Six inner labial setae about 1–2 µm long, six outer labial setae and four cephalic setae united in one circle and about 3–4 µm long. Amphideal fovea circular to longitudinal oval-shaped, with double contours. Roughly two groups of cervical setae each composed of 12–14 setae, with anterior group of setae 2–3 µm long and posterior group 9–13 µm long. Two opposed testes, outstretched, with anterior testis on the left of intestine and posterior one on the right. Spicules long and slender, 3.2–3.9 anal body diameters long. Gubernaculum short and tubular with pointed distal end. Single anteriorly outstretched ovary on the left of intestine. Tail conico-cylindrical, with cylindrical part occupying about half of tail length. Two long and two short terminal setae.

Type material.
Two males and one female. Male holotype on slide KP-D18-1. Male paratype on slide KP- D08-1. Female paratype on slide KP-D81-1.

Type locality and habitat.
Muddy sediments at stations D18 ( 14°39'N , 134°51'E ), D08 ( 13°05'N , 134°52'E ) and D81 ( 13°35'N , 135°39'E ) from an abyssal plain of the Philippine Sea near the Southern Kyushu-Palau Ridge in the tropical Western Pacific Ocean ( Fig. 1 ). Station D18, water depth 4472 m , median particle diameter 6 µm, organic matter content 0.55%. Station D08, water depth 3920 m . Station D81, water depth 5176 m , median particle diameter 5 µm, organic matter content 0.14%.
Etymology. Composition of the Latin adjective longus (long) and the Latin noun spicula (spicule), referring to the long spicules of the species.

Description. Morphometric data shown in Table 1 . Body slender, gradually tapering towards tail end, with head region narrower than body trunk ( Fig. 2A ). Cuticle very faintly striated, indistinct as observed under light microscope, about 8 µm per 10 annulations. Somatic setae sparse, 4–5 µm long, irregularly arranged along the body ( Fig. 2A ). Buccal cavity elongate cylindro-conical, unarmed and cuticularized, 12–14 µm deep and 5 µm wide ( Figs 2B, C , 3A, B ). Six inner labial setae about 1 µm long, six outer labial setae and four cephalic setae united in a circle of six groups and about 3 µm long ( Figs 2B, C , 3A–C ).

Amphideal fovea slightly longitudinally oval and strongly cuticularized with double contours ( Figs 2B, C , 3B ). Roughly two groups of cervical setae each composed of 12 setae: anterior group of setae located at same level of amphideal fovea, 2–3 µm long; posterior group situated about 1.5 corresponding body diameters posteriorly, 9–11 µm long ( Figs 2B , 3A, B ). Pharynx cylindrical, with weak radial muscular striation, slightly widened at base, occupying 16.6–16.7% of total body length. Cardia small, cordate, and surrounded by intestine tissue ( Fig. 3E ). Nerve ring located in middle portion of pharynx. Excretory pore and ventral gland not observed.

Tail conico-cylindrical, 7.1–9.5 anal body diameters long, cylindrical part occupying about half of tail length ( Fig. 2A, E ). Three caudal glands confined within the tail, one conspicuously larger than the others ( Figs 2E , 3D ). Four terminal setae, two long ones 12–14 µm long and two short ones 3–7 µm long ( Figs 2E , 3F ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Paramphimonhystrella longispicula
sp. n.
(A, C, female paratype; B, D & E, male holotype) A: Overall view, showing the ovary; B–C: Lateral view of anterior body region, showing the elongated cylindro-conical buccal cavity and the much longer cervical setae in the posterior circle; D: Lateral view of cloacal region, showing the spicules and gubernaculum; E: Lateral view of tail region, showing the three caudal glands and four terminal setae. Scale bars: 30 µm.

FIGURE 3.
Paramphimonhystrella longispicula
sp. n.
A–B: Lateral view of anterior portion of the male holotype, showing the elongated conical buccal cavity, amphideal fovea, and cervical setae; C: Lateral view of anterior portion of the female paratype, showing the long conical buccal cavity; D: Lateral view of cloacal region, showing the long spicule; E: Lateral view of pharynx and cardia (arrow) of the female paratype; F: Terminal setae of the male holotype; G: Reproductive system of the female paratype, showing the vulva (arrowhead) and the short postvulvar sac with numerous sperm cells. Scale bars: 15 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Males . Two opposed testes, outstretched, with the anterior one on the left of intestine, and the posterior one on the right of intestine. Two long and slender spicules, 3.2–3.9 anal body diameters long, slightly cuticularized ( Figs 2D , 3D ). Gubernaculum short and tubular, with pointed distal end, 13–17 µm long. Precloacal supplements absent ( Figs 2D , 3D ).

Female . Similar to males but with circular amphideal fovea ( Fig. 2C ; vs . slightly longitudinally oval in males) and a slightly higher number of cervical setae in the first group (14 vs . 12). Single anteriorly outstretched ovary on the left of intestine ( Fig. 2A ). Postvulvar sac short with numerous sperm cells ( Figs 2A , 3G ). Vulva located at midbody ( Figs 2A , 3G ).

Species differentiation. Within the genus
Paramphimonhystrella
, only the new species
P. longispicula
sp. n.
,
P. eurystoma
sp. n.
described below, and
P. barbula Leduc, 2014
possess long and slender spicules (>2.7 anal body diameters), while the other species have short spicules (<1.7abd) ( Fig. 7 ). Both
P. longispicula
sp. n.
and
P. barbula
were found from the deep-sea sediments and the former species represents the deepest record for the genus.
Paramphimonhystrella longispicula
sp. n.
can be easily separated from
P. barbula
by the broad buccal cavity (5 µm vs . 1–2 µm wide), the unequally long cervical setae (2–3 µm long in the anterior group and 9–13 µm long in the posterior group vs . all of equal length and about 3–6 µm long), and a higher number of terminal setae (4 vs . invariably 2).
Paramphimonhystrella longispicula
sp. n.
differs distinctly from
P. eurystoma
sp. n.
by the number of terminal setae (4 vs . 2), the short and simple gubernaculum ( vs . long and peculiar gubernaculum with two capitula) and the absence of a hammer-shaped cuticularized piece which is situated ventrally and posterior to vagina ( vs . presence).

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Morphometric data and individual measurements (in µm) of
Paramphimonhystrella longispicula
sp. n.

tr.th: Length of cervical setae 1 st group

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Body length 1167–1208 µm. Buccal cavity cylindro-conical, 14–23 µm deep and 9–12 µm wide. Six inner labial setae about 3–4 µm long; six outer labial setae 7–8 µm long and four cephalic setae 4–5 µm long, forming a circle. Amphideal fovea slightly oval with double contours. Roughly two groups of cervical setae, 8–11 µm long in anterior group and 12–18 µm long in posterior group. Two outstretched testes on the left of intestine. Spicules long and slender, 64–71 µm (2.4–2.8 anal body diameters). Gubernaculum strongly cuticularized with two capitula in proximal end, 25–28 µm long (one anal body diameter). Single ovary anteriorly outstretched on the left of intestine. A hammer-shaped cuticularized piece immediately posterior to vagina. Tail conico-cylindrical, with cylindrical part occupying about half of tail length. Two terminal setae, 23–31 µm long.

Type material.
Five males and one female. Male holotype on slide DH5-2-1. Male paratypes on slides DH5-2- 2, DH5-2-3, DH5-2-4 and DH5-2-5. Female paratype on slide CJ-6-1.

Type locality and habitat.
Muddy sediments at stations DH5-2 ( 28°47' N , 122°50' E ) and CJ-6 ( 32°30' N , 125° 00' E ) in the East China Sea. Station DH5-2, water depth 64 m , water temperature at the sediment-water interface 21.0°C, salinity 32.7, median particle diameter 19 µm, silt-clay 87.1%, and organic matter 1.3%. Station CJ-6, water depth 55 m , water temperature at the sediment–water interface 18.1°C, salinity 34.2, median particle diameter 235 µm, silt-clay 46.5%, and organic matter 0.4%.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Morphometric data and individual measurements (in µm) of
P. eurystoma
sp. n.

tr.th: Length of cervical setae 1 st group Length of cervical setae 2nd group

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4.
Paramphimonhystrella eurystoma
sp. n.
(A–B, D–F, male holotype; C, G, female paratype) A: Overall view, showing the testes; B–C: Lateral view of anterior body region, showing the cylindro-conical buccal cavity, slightly oval amphideal fovea with double contours, and the two circles of cervical setae; D: Lateral view of cloacal region, showing the long and slender spicule (arrowhead) and short and strongly cuticularized gubernaculum, with two capitula in the proximal end (arrow) and three caudal glands confined within the tail, one conspicuously larger than the others; E: Gubernaculum, showing the short and strongly cuticularized gubernaculum with two capitula in the proximal end; F: Right side view of posterior region, showing the longitudinal line on the cuticle; G: Reproductive system, showing the single anterior ovary, hammer-shaped cuticularized piece (arrowhead) and the short postvulvar sac with numerous sperm cells. Scale bars: 30 µm.

FIGURE 5.
Paramphimonhystrella eurystoma
sp. n.
(A–B, D, H–J, male holotype; C, E–G, a female paratype) A–C, G: Lateral view of anterior body region, showing the cylindro-conical buccal cavity, the slightly oval amphideal fovea with double contours, and the two circles of cervical setae; D: Right side view of posterior region, showing the longitudinal line on cuticle (arrow); E: Reproductive system, showing the vulva, hammer-shaped cuticularized piece (arrowhead) and the short postvulvar sac with numerous sperm cells; F: Three caudal glands confined within the tail, one conspicuously larger than the others; H: Two long terminal setae; I: Gubernaculum, showing the strongly cuticularized gubernaculum with two capitula in the proximal end (arrow); J: Lateral view of cloacal region, showing the long and slender spicule (arrowhead) and the capitula in the proximal end of gubernaculum (arrow). Scale bars: 30 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. Composite of the Greek adjective eurys (broad) and the Greek noun stoma (mouth), refers to the broad buccal cavity of the species.

Description. Morphometric data shown in Table 2 . Body slender, gradually tapering towards tail end, with head region narrower than body trunk ( Fig. 4A ). Cuticle striated, about 17 µm per 10 annulations. About 13–15 setae located within 4.8–7.3 corresponding body diameters behind pharynx base, 11–19 µm long; other somatic setae sparse, irregularly arranged along body, 3–10 µm long ( Fig. 4A ). Buccal cavity cylindro-conical, unarmed and cuticularized, 14–20 µm deep and 9–10 µm wide ( Figs 4B, C , 5B ). Six inner labial setae about 3–4 µm long; six jointed outer labial setae 7–8 µm long and four slightly jointed cephalic setae 4–5 µm long, united in a circle ( Figs 4B, C , 5A ).

Amphideal fovea slightly oval and strongly cuticularized, with double contours ( Figs 4B, C , 5A, C ). Roughly two groups of cervical setae: setae in anterior group 8–11 µm long and at same level of amphideal fovea, those in posterior group 12–18 µm long and situated about 1.5 corresponding body diameters posteriorly ( Figs 4B, C , 5A, B ). Pharynx cylindrical, with weak radial muscular striation, slightly widened at base, occupying 14.6–15.7% of total body length. Cardia surrounded by intestine tissue, small and cordate. Nerve ring located in middle portion of pharynx. Excretory pore and ventral gland not observed.

Tail conico-cylindrical, 9.0–10.3 anal body diameters long, cylindrical part occupying about half of tail length ( Fig. 4A, C ). Three caudal glands confined within tail, one conspicuously larger than the others ( Figs 4A, C , 5F ). Two long and robust terminal setae 23–31 µm long ( Figs 4A, C , 5H ).

Female . Single ovary anteriorly outstretched on the left of intestine ( Fig. 4G ). Postvulvar sac long, with numerous sperm cells ( Figs 4G , 5E ). Mature eggs up to 93 µm long and 20 µm wide ( Fig. 4G ). Vulva located at mid-body. A hammer-shaped cuticularized piece situated ventrally and immediately posterior to vagina, about 14 µm long and 2 µm wide ( Figs 4G , 5E ).

Species differentiation.
Paramphimonhystrella eurystoma
sp. n.
possesses a distinctive hammer-shaped cuticularized piece situated ventrally and immediately posterior to vagina, a structure present also in females of
P. glossalga Leduc, 2014
and
P. scutula Leduc, 2014
. This is a rather peculiar feature in the order Monhysterida , while its function is still not known ( Leduc 2014 ).
Paramphimonhystrella eurystoma
sp. n.
can be distinguished from
P. glossalga
and
P. scutula
by the peculiar gubernaculum with two capitula in the proximal end ( Fig. 3E ). In all the other congeners including the new species
P. longispicula
sp. n.
, the gubernaculum is either small and simple or absent.
